commentBody:
The New York Times should be more a bit more responsible for publishing articles like this because without disclosure of the potential risks taking arnica, ordinary people may start using this remedy without full knowledge of how this can impact them.

Here is a link that is helpful...

http://umm.edu/health/medical/altmed/herb/arnica

replies.commentBody: "It should be noted that arnica do mato, which is also known as lychnophora ericoides, is not the same as arnica montana, a plant that grows in mountainous regions of Europe and is commonly sold as an over-the-counter homeopathic remedy for soreness, bruising and swelling. They are more like distant cousins."
